name: Mysore Masala Dosa
history: Mysore Masala Dosa is a popular variant of the classic South Indian dosa, originating from the city of Mysore. It's known for its spicy red chutney spread and potato filling.
description: Mysore Masala Dosa is a crispy crepe made from fermented rice and lentil batter, smeared with a spicy garlic and red chili chutney, and filled with a savory potato mixture. It's often served with coconut chutney and sambar.

equipment.name: blender or grinder
equipment.description: Used for grinding the batter ingredients and chutney.

equipment.name: pan
equipment.description: Used for preparing the potato filling.

equipment.name: spatula
equipment.description: Used for spreading and flipping the dosas.

instructions.title: Prepare Potato Filling
instructions.description: Boil the potatoes, peel and mash them. In a pan, heat oil, add mustard seeds, urad dal, and curry leaves. When they splutter, add onions, green chilies, and turmeric. Add mashed potatoes and salt, mix well.

instructions.title: Make Red Chutney
instructions.description: Grind red chilies, garlic, tamarind, and salt with a little water to make a smooth paste.

instructions.title: Cook the Dosas
instructions.description: Heat a non-stick skillet or tawa. Pour a ladleful of dosa batter and spread it into a thin circle. Apply some red chutney over it. Place a portion of the potato filling in the center, fold the dosa.

instructions.title: Serve
instructions.description: Serve the Mysore Masala Dosa hot with coconut chutney and sambar.

tips: Ensure the dosa batter is of the right consistency for a crispy texture.
Cook the dosa on a medium flame for even browning.
variations: Add finely chopped vegetables or paneer to the potato filling for a twist.
Adjust the spice levels in the red chutney according to taste preferences.

storage.shelfLife: Dosa batter can be refrigerated for up to 2 days. Prepared masala should be consumed fresh.
storage.instructions: Store batter in an airtight container in the refrigerator. Reheat dosas on a skillet for best texture.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat dosas on a skillet until crisp.
presentationTips: Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve on a traditional banana leaf.
